name: Responsible Government at Last
description: Having defeated the Boers, the time has come to build a responsible, British-style government to our lands.

name: Border Infrastructure with South Africa
description: While we were victorious in the Third Boer War, it would be wise to set up border fortifications to defend from possible incursions from our southern aggressor.

name: Issue Passports
description: It is essential for our new nation to give passports to our citizens.

name: Establish the Gonarezhou reserve
description: The Gonarezhou is vast and filled with beautiful wildlife, and we must keep it this way. We should consider declaring it a national reserve in order to better protect it's natural state.

name: Combat Poaching
description: Poaching has become a large threat to the Rhodesian wildlife, it is essential that we take measures to eliminate the poaching of wildlife.

name: Attract Wildlife Tourism
description: Our natural wildlife is a gift. Knowing this, we could use it to our advantage by gaining some extra revenue by attracting safari tourism.

name: Anglicize the Bureaucracy
description: Now that we are, for the first time, beholden only to our own desires, we need no longer account for Afrikaans, the South African language rarely spoken north of the Limpopo, in our bureaucracy. English, and only English, shall do...

name: Invite Imperial Experts
description: It is utterly important that we invite experts from the crown to guide us in building up our newly independent homeland.

name: Expand the Native Reserves
description: The current native reservers are small and their people are overcrowded. It is only natural that we expand these reserves to allow for some prosperity in the native communities

name: Draft a Constitution
description: A constitution will provide us with stability and certainty of future governance. It is of the utmost priority that a constitution for Southern Rhodesia be drafted.

name: Establish the Southern Rhodesia Currency Board
description: In order to better manage the currency situation here in Rhodesia, we must establish a currency board which will guide this process.

name: Legalize Sweepstaking
description: Sweepstaking, should it be legalized, would provide us with a large amount of much needed income. This corse of action is necessary if we wish to continue to grow our new economy.

name: Bring back the Rhodesian Pound
description: Having regained our independence from the Union of South Africa, it would be most wise to restore our old currency - the Rhodesian Pound.

name: A Stable Administration
description: A responsible government brings prosperity and stability to a nation. With our fast growing economy, it is fair to call our administration stable.

name: Plugging the Hole
description: South Rhodesian immigration has been likened to a bucket with a hole in it with those deemed desirable entering the country only to leak out of the hole elsewhere. We must rectify this with making South Rhodesia more accommodating to them

name: Cross the Zambezi
description: Across the Zambezi lays North Rhodesia, taken from the British after the collapse of their empire, we have yet to be under the same flag. However, opportunity may just allow us to take back what is rightfully ours.

name: Reform the Education System
description: Our current education system, is...well, lacking to say the least. In order to better improve the welfare of our people, we must reform our system of education.

name: Establish The Supreme Court
description: An essential part of a Responsible Government is accountability, creating a supreme court to reside over the interpretation of laws and the constitution.

name: Curtail the Railway Unions
description: The railway unions are a nuisance for the progress of our nation. In order to advance our railways, we must suppress them.

name: Negotiate with the Railway Unions
description: While we could just suppress the unions, it may be more beneficial for the overall unity of the nation if we were to work with them.

name: The Salisbury-Beira Line
description: A massive project, it as been decided that a line will connect Salisbury and Beria by railroad.

name: Industrial Conciliation Act
description: The Industrial Conciliation Act borrows heavily from it's South African counterpart with it's end goal to protect the interest of white workers over their black counterparts.

name: Fixing the Damage
description: The Boers were not kind to us, with our civilian infrastructure heavily damaged during the fighting. Thanks to our Entente benefactors, we have the funds, and the means to make most needed repairs.

name: Expand the University College of Rhodesia
description: An initiative has been put into place to expand the University College of Rhodesia to promote the immigration of intellects to Southern Rhodesia and to allow for trades to be taught in an effort to kick start South Rhodesia economy

name: Expand our Infrastructure
description: Southern Rhodesia is fairly far away from... Basically everywhere besides South Africa. If we are to diversify our currently predominantly agricultural economy to seriously compete with our South African neighbours, we need to work on our national infrastructure.

name: Support the Rhodesia Sugar Refinery
description: Such cash crops, like sugar are vital to the recovery of the South Rhodesian economy. With this in mind, we shall support our local sugar refineries via the means of stimulus packages.

name: Develop Bulawayo Industry
description: Bulawayo has always been the centre of Rhodesian industrial hub. With further investment from the Entente, we further develop vital industrial hub.

name: Subsidies Northern Maize Farmers
description: Akin to our sugar industry, our maize production must be supported if we are to further recover our industries, with subsidies being afforded to our farmers.

name: Tariffs with South Africa
description: Relations are still rocky between Salisbury and Pretoria, with neither wishing to make any accommodations towards each other. With this, we must impose harsh tariffs on any goods that hail from South Africa, till such a time the such accommodations are made.

name: Economic Reconciliation
description: Though we have had our differences, diplomats from both South Africa and Rhodesia have been looking to ease tensions. With this in mind, trade between the two nations has normalised, with both nations accepting each other goods.

name: Counter Cattle Diseases
description: With further research and development into preventives of diseases that effect our lucrative cattle industry has allowed for the use of more land previously unsuitable, allowing for a small expansion of rural towns within the country

name: Invest in RCL&R Ltd.
description: RCL&R Ltd. have proven them selfs to be a company worthy of investment, it would be wise to help their growth.

name: Economic Boom
description: Salisbury has recovered from the Third Boer War, and it's economy has stabilized greatly.

name: Nationalize the Utility Companies
description: Under the control of the government, we will be better able to run the utilities of our nation.

name: Nationalize Rhodesian Railways
description: The railway companies have proven them selfs to be unable to run the railways properly. It has been decided that they are to be nationalized.

name: Subsidize the Utility Companies
description: Instead of nationalization of the utilities, it would be better if we were to give them subsidies to improve their growth.

name: Subsidize Rhodesian Railways
description: Instead of nationalization of the railways, it would be better if we were to give them subsidies to improve their growth.

name: Counter Inefficient Work
description: Inefficient work has been a long standing problem in Rhodesia, and it is about time we tackle it.

name: Third Boer War Begins
description: South Rhodesia shall no longer follow the direction from those Boerish fools and look to ourselves to lead South Rhodesia into the future

name: Mobilize the Reserves
description: A rally cry has began in Salisbury, with it being heard as far as Broken Hill. Young men are flocking to our cause to supplement our forces to fight of the Boer menace.

name: Supplies from the North
description: Arms are being secured from our northern brethren. Though it does shame us to use German weapons, in times of need one must look beyond such distaste for the greater good

name: South Rhodesian Territorial Forces
description: With the civil war over, the formation of a more formal army is required though an army may be to forward for some

name: Achieve Standardization
description: South Rhodesia armoury is in a poor state, with arms ranging from those used in the great war to modern German firearms. Standardization is key to this man's army

name: Canadian Advisors
description: With South Rhodesia looking to Ottawa with advisors assisting our armed forces work alongside those of the Entente.

name: Rhodesian Intelligence Corp
description: During the Civil War, the need for information became paramount to ensure our limited forces were where they were needed. With this, the formation of the Rhodesian Intelligence Corp to ensure the security is maintainted both internally and externally.

name: The Northern Initiative
description: With the civil war over, those who came down from the north to fight for southern freedom have either began to settle in South Rhodesia or return back to their homes. Seeing these fine men returning back to their foreign ruled homes, the government has set up an initiative to attract further immigration from the north.

name: Expand the Arsenal
description: Guns, ammo and well greased logistic system wins wars, which South Rhodesia is lacking. This must be rectified

name: Reform the South Rhodesian Staff Corp
description: With South Rhodesia's small population, the need for compulsory military training is a hard reality for South Rhodesia

name: Light Infantry Doctrine
description: Refining the hit and run tactics used in the civil war has resulted in the birth of South Rhodesian Commando units.

name: Motorized Infantry
description: The concept of motorized infantry has been welcomed by the Southern Rhodesian Territorial Forces. With the ability to deploy and redeploy rapidly has allowed for great synergy with it's infantry hit and run tactics

name: Raising Native Regiments
description: The reality on the ground is there the need for bodies in the South Rhodesian Territorial Forces regardless of colour or creed, with 'commodities' being made

name: 'Coloured' NCOs
description: The need for trusted coloured NCOS is paramount, with a 'middle man' needed between the white officers and the black soldiers to ensure basic unit cohesion

name: Reinstate the African Rifles
description: Further initiatives have been implemented to raise draw more from the native population with training and 'trust' given to our native brethren

name: Pamwe Chete
description: 'Pamwe Chete' a Shona phrase meaning "all together" is the motto of the newly raised Selous Scouts, named after British explorer Frederick Selous. This mix raced unit has been created to be the 'crème de la crème' of the Southern Rhodesian Territorial Forces.

name: Light Armour
description: Further development of the motorized infantry doctrine has led to the use of light tanks to provided the much needed punch that's required in a modern battlefield

name: Southern Rhodesia Air Corp
description: An integrated air wing has been created to provide greater synergy between the ground and air forces of South Rhodesia

name: Women's Auxiliary Air Services
description: The battlefield is no place for a woman, but with the pressing need to expand our military branches, exceptions have been made allowing for the formation of an Auxiliary unit for the Air Corps

name: Entente Planes
description: Having little to no aviation industry to call their own, South Rhodesia must turn to her allies to provide the needs their Air Corp needs

name: Signaller Corps
description: The introduction of the radio and further developments have allowed for the creation of a signaller corp to be relay information on the ground to our pilots above

name: Entente Listening Post in Africa
description: South Rhodesia must keep it's ear to the ground and it's eyes to it's neighbors.

name: Integrated CAS
description: The introduction of the Signaller Corp and advancement of radio technology has allowed for greater coordination between our forces on the ground and those in the air

name: Form the King's Rhodesian Armed Forces
description: The King himself has an announcement regarding the Southern Rhodesian Territorial Forces
